tool.name: AddSPTFields

param.name: in_drainage_line_features
param.dialogReference: This is the drainage line feature class that you would like to upload to the Streamflow Prediction Tool.

param.name: ECMWF_Watershed_Name
param.dialogReference:
The format of the ECMWF dataset name on the data store server is erfp-[watershed name]-[subbasin name]-[forecast timestamp] .

Example: erfp-magdalena-el_banco-20150603t00

In the example, you would use: magdalena

param.name: ECMWF_Subbasin_Name
param.dialogReference:
The format of the ECMWF dataset name on the data store server is erfp-[watershed name]-[subbasin name]-[forecast timestamp] .

Example: erfp-magdalena-el_banco-20150603t00

In the example, you would use: el_banco

param.name: WRF_Hydro_Watershed_Name
param.dialogReference:
The format of the WRF-Hydro dataset name on the data store server is wrfp-[watershed name]-[subbasin name]-[year]-[month]

Example: wrfp-nfie_wrfhydro-conus-2015-6

In the example, you would use: nfie_wrfhydro

param.name: WRF_Hydro_Subbasin_Name
param.dialogReference:
The format of the WRF-Hydro dataset name on the data store server is wrfp-[watershed name]-[subbasin name]-[year]-[month]

Example: wrfp-nfie_wrfhydro-conus-2015-6

In the example, you would use: conus

tool.summary: This adds the fields required by the Streamflow Prediction Tool web application to the Drainage Lines.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This adds the fields required by the Streamflow Prediction Tool web application to the Drainage Lines.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Created by Alan D. Snow, US Army ERDC
